definitions.text: the trace of a point whose direction of motion changes
a line on a graph representing data
a pitch of a baseball that is thrown with spin so that its path curves as it approaches the batter
the property possessed by the curving of a line or surface
curved segment (of a road or river or railroad track etc.)

examples: The car cut to the left at the intersection
The motorbike veered to the right
The road winds around the lake
the path twisted through the forest

definitions.text: form a curl, curve, or kink
examples: the cigar smoke curled up at the ceiling
